website_summaries.verdict: If you need a low-priced laptop that succeeds at basic tasks, this small Chromebook works well.
pros: Very small laptop that makes it easy to carry with you anywhere
Low price point yields a laptop that's affordable for students
Offers a battery life of up to 9 hours
Basic interface that's easy to operate, even for novices

customer_reviews.title: Compact, great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Love this small computer! I needed an inexpensive laptop to complete some work for my masters degree and this does the trick! No need for MS programs as Google has it all, and is able to convert any Google doc to a Word doc and vice verse. The other great thing is that everything gets saved in your google drive and can be accessed anywhere! The laptop is lightweight, compact, and the battery holds a 10 hour charge. It’s awesome! Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kandice N.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little machine!
customer_reviews.text: Just got two of these for 2 teens starting highschool. First time Chrome OS users but its pretty easy to navigate & they'll be able to do everything they need to do. Display is bright & keyboard feels great. Got some colored hardcase covers & rainbow keyboard pads, so they're customizable (which is nice for teens who want some personalization). Overall really happy with these so far.
customer_reviews.author: jenna

customer_reviews.title: Never a problem, ever.
customer_reviews.text: I had the older version of this laptop, I must have had it for close to ten years, one of the keys started sticking so I decided to get a new one. Until that time I never once had a problem with it, never. When I told some friends I was going to get a Chromebook they scoffed, these little laptops are fantastic little workhorses. No it won't run Photoshop or complex, expensive programs, they aren't made for that. These little laptops are PERFECT for surfing the web, watching videos on the web etc. They update themselves and take care of viruses and problems all by themselves. Fantastic little laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Hodge III

customer_reviews.title: Alrighty Then-Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great but buy a wireless mouse when you buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it yesterday and love it! It's my second chromebook and third Acer. LOVE the simplicity of it and the beautiful white. It kept all my favorites and settings from the old chromebook. Very sharp looking too!
customer_reviews.author: yarvet

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this laptop for school. It is incompatible with many of my online classes.. Microsoft word is very difficult to function on this laptop, and is only available for use online. And although you can use Microsoft word, you can't use many of it's regular features. I would like to return this product, but the return window is sadly closed.
customer_reviews.author: Jolissa Langley

customer_reviews.title: Works similar to a Samsung Chromebook 3 but I like the quality of the picture better
customer_reviews.text: Works similar to a Samsung Chromebook 3 but I like the quality of the picture better, the battery life is slightly better, the keys are more firm, and it's a 2018 product. Thank you. Great purchase for anyone!.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Catalano

customer_reviews.title: Impressive machine!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! My Chromebook came today, and so far, I am impressed! It's got a good keyboard, decent display, and is very fast. Especially at the price Amazon offers this product at, it's a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Stopped connecting to wifi... expensive brick.
customer_reviews.text: This Chomebook stopped connecting to wifi and became a very expensive brick in under two months... twice. The first time I did a factory reset and it still would not recognize any wifi connection. I assumed it was just a bad apple and Amazon was nice enough the replace it, but the second one did exactly the same thing in less time than it took the first. Don't buy this, particularly if you are a student who can't write papers with a brick and doesn't have the time to be constantly returning broken laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Mikayla Eager

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I’m only giving this 1 star because a 0 star is not an option. Customer support is terrible. Chronobook randomly drops network and cant Reconnect. I bought this for my son who has to have it for his studies and it’s unreliable at best. Tech support and customer service were a joke. I’ve decided to return the Acer and by another manufacturer. Acer was no help Amazon customer service was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Murphy

customer_reviews.title: TOUCH PAD not working correctly
customer_reviews.text: Everything was ok at the first, I been using the touch pad normally, but then I used a USB mouse and now the touch pad do not work well, I can't move the cursor, it just let me do clicks. I tried almost everything that I can do and nothing works right now I'm so frustrated Sending back soon :(
customer_reviews.author: Hara713

customer_reviews.title: Really like...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement/upgrade for another Acer Chromebook that I have been using for about 4 years. I love the chromebooks as I can do most of what I need to on this. That being said, there is a couple of things I would wish for. A major one is wishing chromebook could work out something with Garmin so that I could update the maps on my GPS. I do so much on CB that it is hard to justify buying a Windows computer just for a couple of issues. If that could happen would be a huge benefit.
customer_reviews.author: William Denton

customer_reviews.title: screen kept going black
customer_reviews.text: i returned the first laptop and was sent a second. they both had the same trouble. the screen would stay black. i would close the lid for a few minutes, then return and open the lid to a black screen. the video would continue streaming -- i could hear the soundtrack. i would push the button on the side and hold it. i called Acer support, and repeated what they told me to do. finally , got tired of it and returned it for a refund. disappointed as I enjoyed how light weight it is. the battery life wasn't as long as i thought it would be. also, the mouse pads on both machines were sluggish--almost sticky...
customer_reviews.author: Rare Fruit

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t come with an operating system?!?!?!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed! I bought this during prime days for a Christmas present for my son. We just opened it Christmas Day. Turned it on to set up and it tells me Chrome OS is missing or damaged. Of course we are past the window of return. One disappointed kid and an angry momma out of product and $$$.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: died after 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: this piece of junk died on me after 6 weeks! My old one lasted a year and a half and then died. I should of learned my lesson then and not repurchased
customer_reviews.author: Walking dead

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for setting up a linux distro
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to setup up a linux system to use for classwork, GalliumOS has no problems running on this computer if you use the braswell distro Some things to note: The laptop has a write-protection screw, this doesnt need to be removed to get into the OS (ctrl+l at the OS verification is turned off screen will boot into the OS) Audio may not automatically work, you'll need to update galliumOS with the terminal command "galliumos-update" and it should fix it This laptop isn't very powerful, but its lack of moving parts and extremely low weight makes it perfect for a college student or budget developer.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to carry and use. Loud clicking though
customer_reviews.text: Really like how light and portable it is. Screen looks good. My only complaint would be the track pad takes a little time to get used to and the clicking can be loud. So if you're thinking of using this at a library or some other quiet place, get a mouse. The clicking can get annoying. But if you're looking for something that works great, is very cheap and is easy to carry, I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Henry R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: We got two of these for the new school year for our young children and they love them. They're lightweight and durable (one fell off the couch onto the wooden floor without any problems) and have all the features they need. I was afraid that the small screen size would be a problem but they're happy with every aspect of the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Bortolin

customer_reviews.title: Won't open.
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this chromebook today. First time powering up and the message came up - Chrome OS is missing or damaged. When you can't get it operating, not sure it's reasonable to expect someone to log into a recovery site - since it's possible the customer does not have access to a way to save to a eg usb and then try and reload the chromebook. Very disappointed at this point. Will follow up if I am able to recover the Chrome OS system.
customer_reviews.author: New Truck Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop, utilizes google drive for files
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Ended up buying a second one for my grandmother. Lightweight, easy to learn for someone who uses Mac only, long battery life. I do miss the keyboard on my Mac because this one doesn’t have the total appeal as the material of a Mac keyboard but this is a fraction of the price. Keyboard doesn’t light up but not an issue for me. The limited storage is no problem bc this computer converts pretty much everything to a google file that can be stored and accessed anywhere from google drive. Doing this helped me to organize my files better. You can save or download things if you choose but there is limited space.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Buy anything else
customer_reviews.text: This is the most unresponsive, clunky piece of trash I’ve attempted to use in my adult life. You can’t possibly do worse. Buy anything else. Update: You know how sometimes you regret overly critical reviews after time elapses? Well that didn’t happen this time. I’m currently moving any files off it so that I can have the satisfaction of hurling it into a dumpster. Using this computer is like standing in line at the registry of motor vehicles. It reminds me of waiting to log onto the internet in the America Online days. What’s so wrong with it? The touchpad. Every move is grueling. Maybe you’re thinking this is a one off review? Maybe. But why risk it?
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2  from the warehouse. wouldn't work right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: They came in original packaging. Computer repair said it was a bad keyboard. It was a little over 30 days since purchased ,,,,so Amazon wouldn't do anything. Acer wouldn't do anything. Said the warranty started at the beginning of the 1st purchase!!!! So it was expired before we even bought them.! Acer basically said Tough Luck. I will never ever buy from Acer again. It's like selling expired food.........total greed and nondisclosure.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: The Best $200 Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Cons: the touchpad is stiff and boardline unusable for some due to the force required to click on it. Pros: performance/dollar, build quality, size, weight, batter life, and that IPS screen! Get this for the screen alone! The screen on this is better than my $900 Dell Latitude. The IPS screen on this Chromebook is clearly view-able from almost any angle without changes to contrast or color. When you are helping a child do their homework or collaborating with someone this is a crucial feature.
customer_reviews.author: Will Evans

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and don’t buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Does not do anything that I needed it to do. If you’re even thinking about using this with a printer you might want to consider another option. The worst computer I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came with batteries that don't hold a charge??
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like the fact that the batteries don't hold a charge...sent it back for repair!
customer_reviews.author: Joeywankanobe

customer_reviews.title: Nice, compact, lightweight and fast!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the Chromebook for a couple of days but so far it's been easy to use and fast! I'm not an android user so I was prepared for some transitional challenges but they have been slight. My biggest issue is the charging plug doesn't connect (snap) into the Chromebook - I have to keep pushing it in place. Is anyone else experiencing this or am I missing something? Seems like it should click into the port so it wouldn't become disconnected.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Screen won’t work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister so she can use for school. She was very excited, but only 3 months after receiving it, the screen just went black. It has not been dropped or damaged once and she struggles to find ways to get her schoolwork done now that classes are online. I’ve filed a claim with the laptop company and still have not received anything. Also, double check that the warranty is for the date you purchase it and not the date it was purchased by the seller you’re buying from; that threw me for a loop when I tried resolving this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Y.

customer_reviews.title: Beware the power connector
customer_reviews.text: While this Chromebook seems mostly OK, the power connection to the laptop is the worst I have ever encountered in any new product -- by far. The power connection uses a tiny barrel connector, and unless I hold it into the socket or am lucky, the external power does not work. In retrospect, I wish I had returned it immediately after trying the computer. Fortunately, if the battery happens to be charged the battery life is great.
customer_reviews.author: Ex-Geek

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking
customer_reviews.text: If you need a budget laptop or a daily driver for high school (all) or college (humanities only) and you don't want to spend more than $230 (after shipping and taxes) this is the Chromebook to you. Yes, you could probably find cheaper devices, but this one gives you the most premium value for the price. (it goes on sale, so keep an eye out. At this price point only this computer and the Samsung 3 are worth it - avoid everything else). I love Chromebooks, but most are made too cheaply and then people have bad experiences and get stuck with the idea Chromebooks suck. This computer won't leave a bad taste in your mouth, promise!
customer_reviews.author: cristobal rendon

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is fantastic for me! I’m a college student on a budget, I bought this computer on prime day last year, so it’s about to be a year of owning this computer and it works great. I’m able to type out my documents (on google docs) and save them to the computer. The computer does have a camera but it’s low quality. Overall this computer is perfect, lightweight enough to take to school but sturdy enough to not break in me.
customer_reviews.author: selena

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I love this purchase. First, I got the best price for this. It’s been months and I still know that my price point was the lowest in the Tristate area. Second, I think the solid build and function of this machine is a terrific value. Lastly, I picked this up from the Bus, and although it was raining outside, it was a great experience. I would like to add I use this for media, and I have like 15000 pictures and songs on it and it can hold plent more.
customer_reviews.author: sugarchan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little computers
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing little computers for my young sons. They needed small computers for I Ready access for school. These are amazingly fast. I like that I can use Google's family connect to keep tabs on what they are allowed to view and use. Google also let's me send teacher approved apps to their computers. These are great little learning machines.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wojcik

customer_reviews.title: Bullet Proof Computing!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a way to get on the interwebs and still have the opportunity to be productive, use web-based Microsoft products OR Google suite products, this is the machine for you. You can FaceBook, NetFlix, or WHATEVER in a perfect and safe environment. If you have minor children, you can also introduce them to computing in a completely controlled environment with little risk. A Chromebook is the future of computing.
customer_reviews.author: Amanaude

customer_reviews.title: Still works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on Prime Days in July 2018 and have been immensely pleased with it. Never a problem, never a glitch in the nine months I've used it. I use a desktop for most of my needs, but this Acer Chrombook 11 is used when I'm in another part of my house, or when I don't want to fire up the larger desktop. Was a bit reticent on buying a Chromebook, but it's more than met my needs. Haven't checked out the recent versions of the Acer Chromebook, no need to - this one is doing the job it was meant to do and more. I really love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Day

customer_reviews.title: Crap & Junk - stopped working after a year
customer_reviews.text: It worked great the first 4-5 months. My daughter in 10th grade only used it for homework & occasionally to surf the web/watch movies. After month 5 the screen would just go black. We had to hold it a certain way or play with the screen for the light/display to stay on. Not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loads quick and excellent battery life
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for my daughter for school. I own an ACER chromebook and love mine. She told me she likes hers, but she is going to have to get used to using chrome vs Microsoft. Arrived on time. This computer has an excellent battery life. Will purchase again! Great computer for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Mysterious outlook

customer_reviews.title: Okay for a kid. Too cheap for an adult.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4th grader. He uses it to learn Scratch and to do Google Classroom assignments. My 2nd grader uses it to go to PBS kids. It works better than an iPad for such things. They like it. When they need help and I try to use it I'm always struck by how cheap it feels. The track pad doesn't work the best. The screen is meh. But, for the price, I wasn't expecting a high end Apple product. I don't feel bad about letting my kids use it.
customer_reviews.author: abusch38

customer_reviews.title: Quite useful, easy to use, and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: This chromebook is wonderful to perform most chores I need or want to accomplish. This makes nearly every task easy. Rarely, I'm forced to use my desktop computer to view the entire screen. Must admit that I've printed out documents that my desktop would have enabled me to fill out and submit online. Consequently, I've scanned in, faxed, and emailed required documents. Also must admit that this system is not compatible with every application, action, game, or goal.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann

customer_reviews.title: love these cheap little acers
customer_reviews.text: i've had two and i'm super happy with these! My toddler mysteriously broke the first one pulling the screen down way too far, but i was thankful i was only out $180 and just came back and ordered a new one. Although the first one did seem a tad bit better, but this one is still kicking and i'm using it for my business. Chrome books for the win!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great for homework and googling/YouTube
customer_reviews.text: The review asked for the touchscreen rating and the gaming rating but we don't have a touch screen Acer and have not used the laptop for gaming so I couldn't give those even a single star. I bought this for $125 from Amazon on the truck and it was a seamless purchase. Great customer service and easy to figure out how to use it and set it up. We use it for a simple Googling and doing the kids homework. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Travl_grl

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: After a few months the screen would go black, I figured how to tap the screen just right and it would come back on. Now it doesn’t work at all, also doesn’t charge well. It did not last very long. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: HANA VOJTECHOVA

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am a MacBook Air user, but my daughter needed a computer since her school doesn't offer a computer class.. I looked online and found this one, it had good reviews and the price was great. We ordered it, she loves it. We gave it to her for a birthday present, she just turned 8. Its easy enough an 8 year old with no computer skills can handle it. She likes it, we liked the price, its easy to use. Were thinking of ordering one for my mother in law, since its so easy to use and she isn't too tech savvy.
customer_reviews.author: jen081885

customer_reviews.title: DOESNT LAST LONG. THIS WAS THE SECOND ONE I HAVE HAD.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this computer for my grandchildren for high school for homework only. It has already starting to break down.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Thurber

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality
customer_reviews.text: I am very dissapointed. It did not last 1 year. The monitor went black and the repair cost $154!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ml

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: We are an Apple family, but I just wanted an inexpensive laptop for writing, accessing the Internet on the go. After some research I decided to roll the dice with this one. It is a great product for the money. Set up in 30 seconds. Easy to use, about as fast as you would expect for the price. It’s exactly what I was hoping for. Would recommend it for similar purposes. Also bought a colorful case and keyboard protector which snapped on easily. Making it more durable and fun.
customer_reviews.author: "jabberj"

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for college and was a little worried about compatibility when submitting assignments online, but it's actually not a problem at all. I use it all the time even after graduating and it's been a wonderful purchase. It's a little funky to get used to, but it is awesome once you do get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Piece of JUNK
customer_reviews.text: 1st Chromebook was DOA. Returned it and got the replacement, now exactly 2 months after one year warranty period its DEAD. Called customer support got no help. I will think twice before buying Acer products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I was listening to pandora and suddenly the music kept repeating like a broken record player. I checked and found that the screen wouldnt turn on at all. Ive had this laptop for not even 24hrs. Total pos. Dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Brinkerhoff

customer_reviews.title: There is no touch screen
customer_reviews.text: Yeah. This computer isn't touch screen. Idk why the rating system says there is a touch screen rating. Like no. I don't know about gaming because it does lag on tying or doing other things besides google. The computer is still good. 10/10. I would buy again for any reason.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery
customer_reviews.text: Had it a couple months and it already won’t work unless it’s plugged into the wall. The battery sucks! Other than that it is a great little laptop.
customer_reviews.author: danielle lineman

customer_reviews.title: Probably should not be your first choice
customer_reviews.text: The computer comes up fast and performs well. The touch pad is totally useless there is no way to make it work. I attached a mouse and everything works fine but the touchpad remains useless. I use this computer for general spreadsheets and word processing. It does have to have Wi-Fi to operate most tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Donald McBride

customer_reviews.title: not as good as last Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Guess you get what you pay for. I am disappointed in this computer. This Chromebook is much less responsive and the screen resolution far less clear than my last Chromebook. It will not be my "go to device" and I will use it only to access my photos and documents.
customer_reviews.author: Gillian

customer_reviews.title: Not a Fan
customer_reviews.text: The cursor tracker is spasmodic. Very hard to find the sidebar. Works much better with a mouse! I've had the machine less than two full months, and have used it even less. However, yesterday the screen went black and I had to search on the Internet for a solution. Reaction time is slow. Very disappointed in this machine; but then again, you get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Vee

customer_reviews.title: Chrome book is pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: Had to try it out was on the fence between dumping a lot of cash into a Mac book air or trying one of these guys out, so far it has not disappointed my needs of surfing the web /online usage / quick image editing ( I use an external 1TB to store and pull images from) so far not bad Keep in mind your locked into google experience with android apps sooo a little learning curve but hey check the price !!
customer_reviews.author: cgphoto

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a toy laptop
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to Chromebooks, but the ones I've used felt like actual computers. This one feels like a Fisher Price "my first laptop." Something about the keys, the plastic-y feel of the case....I think there are better options in the same price range. I have no idea if this thing will hold up, but it feels pretty flimsy. Upside could be that it's easy to clean?
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Just a little over a year
customer_reviews.text: I love Chromebooks but I was shocked to look up on Amazon that I bought this Chromebook in the Fall of 2018. I need a new one since I cannot connect with the internet anymore with this Chromebook. I will admit that our DSL is slow but the problem is my Chromebook since I can use my husband's computer. I am buying a different one this time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Audet

customer_reviews.title: slowest machine ive ever used
customer_reviews.text: piece of junk. slowest machine ive ever used. tested it on multiple wifi's and it is always junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Stein

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty small but it loads things fairly fast and is easy to navigate.
customer_reviews.text: It's very good if you just need something to go on the internet or type on. The screen itself is pretty small compared to other computers but it's definitely not ridiculously small, or so small that it actively bothers me. There aren't many things you can download onto it but if that's not something that you'd consider to be a deal breaker, I'd recommend it. It's overall pretty simple and small, but that's what you'd expect for something of this price.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Peabody

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a Chromebook before, Windows and Androids have been my OSes of choice. But this was on sale, and I thought it would make a good replacement for my aging Nexus 10. I'm still not used to it, and so far I've been unable to map drives from my home server, but it seems pretty easy to use and intuitive otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Ron B

customer_reviews.title: Just a cheaper price than a TV
customer_reviews.text: I love the quickness of starting, as soon as you lift the lid. However, the battery life is shorter than half the day. But, for the price $89, don't expect too much. I basically watch TV and movies with it.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda D. Diva

customer_reviews.title: Sending it back
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an Acer Chromebook I bought seven years ago--that Acer was a champ. This new one...not so much. Feels cheap, especially the touchpad. The display is nice, but the touchpad is quirky. This unit just feels like it's asking for trouble; sending it back. Edit One month later: did send it back. Bought a different Acer 11 chromebook (Spin 11?), and it's great! Fon only a few dollars more and only slightly heavier, got a great Chromebook. Great picture, great touchpad, feels like a solid piece of equipment...everything that other was NOT!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Goddard

customer_reviews.title: The perfect compact notebook
customer_reviews.text: Great little laptop! Quick, light, and holds a charge forever. Only uses google os, but you can save and send docs as office docs too though! I love it and it works perfectly. Since it runs on a memory card, no overheating while holding in your lap or tabletop.
customer_reviews.author: Reese B.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: My students love the acres that were donated to our classroom. The white ones are so sleek and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Extremely cheaply made. Would not recommend. There's nothing that I do like about it.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley  Ramkissoon

customer_reviews.title: Great chromebook
customer_reviews.text: What a versatile little laptop! I use Dell Chromebooks at my school, but I like this one much better. I find it a lot easier to navigate, and it's slimmer. Great bargain. The touch pad needs a firm touch to operate though, so I got a mouse to use with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Acer Name / Great Pricing
customer_reviews.text: Great price / Acer brand ... This product has given me no issues and was good to go right out of the box. It is more proficient than my previous older model which I loved and they have addressed issues I had with the hinges by making them more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ken W

customer_reviews.title: did not work
customer_reviews.text: I could not get it to turn on but only once.
customer_reviews.author: wayne

customer_reviews.title: Can I buy them app for PDF what the hell they're free
customer_reviews.text: this son of a gun has to pay for all the PDFs files as the nature of the beast I do not like it it does not page up or down properly when I'd like it to in the fields hard to find the tab to make the page move around do not like that feature at all Google get on it and fix this Acer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: very nice device, fast and very easy to use. although I had to update the Chrome Os to be able to use some apps like camera
customer_reviews.author: Ana Jacomini

customer_reviews.title: The best laptop I ever had
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is the best laptop I ever had. Its great, easy to use, easy to set up and its very light weight which is great since I will be bringing it to school and work every day. My boyfriend has the same brand and he loves it. Thus is faster and better than my HP laptop which just crashed on me a few weeks ago. I seriously recommend this laptop to anyone who is looking for a great laptop. Also, the price is great and I'm happy I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small, lighweight & long battery life
customer_reviews.text: I really love my chromebook, it's small, light weight and perfect for browsing the web which is pretty much what I do with it. The battery lasts a long time and it doesn't take forever to start. I'm really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy224

customer_reviews.title: Display stopped working twice since we bought it 5 months ago
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this in July '18 for my daughter. About 4 months in, the display stopped working. No evidence of drops or bumps - just stopped working. Returned (we paid 1 way shipping) and they fairly quickly turned it around with the note the display cable was replaced. 3-4 weeks later, the display is not working again so we will have to send back for repair. Our son has the Asus ruggedized Chromebook and it has lasted for 1.5 years with no issues (and more bumps and bruises).
customer_reviews.author: j - NC

customer_reviews.title: Portable, reliable, light.
customer_reviews.text: I love this Chromebook. I've had it for months now. It has a good battery life and has given me zero problems. I use it mainly for updating my blog/website, saving photos to Drive, etc. It'd also be great for students.
customer_reviews.author: NashMom

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 year old daughter for Christmas. Worked 1 day. Froze up and now won't turn on. Returning and debating if I'm going to order another one.
customer_reviews.author: love it

customer_reviews.title: Black Screen
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Acer Chromebook 11 3 months ago and worked fine until it didn't charge anymore. Sent back to manufacture and they fixed the charging part but the screen is black. I can see the lights (blue) going on and off but no screen. Want a new one!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Granddad

customer_reviews.title: Love my Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Only have a couple of months, but I love my Chromebook. Battery lasts a long time, all day use for me. I do not have the touchscreen option. Very lighweight and portable. I wasn't sure how I was going to like the OS, but I think Chromebooks are the only Laptop I will ever buy. I purchased an Acer due to price and have experience from Dell's at work and I really do not see any difference in the two other than lower cost with the Acer.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Dead machine
customer_reviews.text: This machine is very cheap feeling and not made well. It was dead on arrival and wouldn't charge.
customer_reviews.author: el

customer_reviews.title: Got 2 of these for Christmas 2018 for niece's sons.
customer_reviews.text: They love them. So does my niece. I heard she uses them everyday too.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Evans

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I love how fast and efficient this chrome book is. I use it for all my classes. Only thing to be aware of is that you cannot download office 365 on this and the word, PowerPoint,and excel that you can download from the App Store are different from the ones on office 365. I had to use another computer in order to be able to use the excel my professors wanted. Otherwise, it is a pretty amazing chrome book for the price.
customer_reviews.author: ximena

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Needed to get my son a device that was easy to use and didn't require a lot of effort to set up. Connected to his google account and he was off and running. Great device and a pretty cool price point as well.
customer_reviews.author: DubhlG

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I love this little netbook. I bought it mainly for watching Netflix, video chat, and browsing. The battery doesn't take long to charge and lasts 8+ hours. I've had it four about 8 months and still love it. I would recommend getting yourself a wireless mouse, though, because the trackpad is absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Raholli

customer_reviews.title: Great school laptop
customer_reviews.text: Its a great price for a school laptop. A small investment that I'm not too worried about lugging around and possibly getting stole. Sync seamlessly with your google account. BUIILT FOR THE INTERNET. It opens websites quickly and easily access your google drive any other google thing with a quick click. It's an awesome tool for any avid google user.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap! Don’t buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! Right out the box it was giving me errors trying to create a supervised user. Restarted the system and then that option was gone completely! Piece of crap!
customer_reviews.author: rdcs86

customer_reviews.title: Kids love this Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these Acer Chromebooks back in March of this year. I wanted to wait to give a review. Both of my kids love them. One uses it for her high school classes and the other is in middle school. They are able to do everything they want and need for school plus some online gaming and Netflix watching. I am very happy with them and my kids are too.
customer_reviews.author: amsulo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing battery life for a good price!
customer_reviews.text: The battery life on this thing is amazing (around 12 hours of on-screen time) and it's perfect for taking notes in college classes and such. The screen is a bit small and takes some getting used to but for the price you can't complain. Helps if you're already familiar with Google products before purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy Laptop Alternative
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to have a laptop that isn’t 14” and 8lbs, so I can travel without back pain. This Chromebook is a cheap, lightweight alternative to a large laptop. As long as you aren’t trying to produce a movie or design a billboard on this laptop - you’ll be fine. It’s fast with good graphics and works seemlessly with your Google account.
customer_reviews.author: Mikayla

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: I love my laptop. Its fast and does what i need it to.
customer_reviews.author: christin collett

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold a charge well
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight device. Seems like I’m always charging it, even when I haven’t used it much. Was planning to use it as my main computer at work (teacher) but I’ll have to leave it on my desk plugged in most of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Julia C.

customer_reviews.title: Concerned!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's birthday in August for high school. Six month's later it no longer connects to WiFi. I'm returning for repairs, hopefully, it can be fixed, my son starts college in September! Will update.
customer_reviews.author: Kib

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Not for gamers as you cannot download some games like Fortnight, but it's a very good computer for school. Sign up on a google account and all of the applications are free to download. Very lightweight and user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I owned this model for the last 4 years and it worked like a champ. The wifi hardware recently went and I bought this as a replacement. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Justice

customer_reviews.title: Don’t but
customer_reviews.text: Horrible computer, barely works and loads extremely slowly. The customer service isn’t good and it’s only one year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: RamsRule

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and good value
customer_reviews.text: This is a good computer for a high school kid who gets assignments from the Google cloud. The browser is also good for watching Netflix. A good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I was worried about the performance of this Chromebook before I ordered it. I was looking for something small, light, and cheap to have around my house or to bring with me when I travel and this seemed to check all the boxes. This Chromebook hasn't disappointed me at all. It certainly isn't blazing fast, but it has been perfectly adequate for browsing the web, writing emails, writing google docs, etc. The battery life has been amazing, I've been getting a solid 8 hours of use out of it. If you want something cheap to do any web-based tasks I would highly recommend this Chromebook!
customer_reviews.author: John Freed

customer_reviews.title: Not for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Sucks you can’t play games on it because it’s a chrome book. Only App Store games and most of them don’t work because it’s not touch screen. My USB port doesn’t work. And even if you find a game that does work it lags. If you have more than one thing up it lags.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: Top shelf quality. I highly recommend it. Remember that this laptop is NOT meant to store large amounts of memory or gaming. If you need something basic for work or school- this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: alan six

customer_reviews.title: Didn't think I really needed one,  but now I can't imagine not having one.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little guy! Bought him for a great price off the Amazon truck. So excited!
customer_reviews.author: Huma

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this on the Treasure Truck for a Xmas gift. Great price and pretty light weight. Wish I could have ordered a second one, but apparently the TT rule is one item per Amazon account.
customer_reviews.author: Chucky

customer_reviews.title: better off buying a real laptop
customer_reviews.text: This laptop doesn't have a home button to view all your files, CAPS button is replaced with a search button. The google apps are not that much easier to use, just work off google browser. I've had this computer for a couple of days and it lags just as much as my 3-year old laptop computer if you have more than a handful of tabs open. Drag and drop barely works as a function. Overall just a cheap cheap cheap product. I wouldn't recommend and am considering returning to invest in something better.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Lizbeth

customer_reviews.title: Trouble Free
customer_reviews.text: This is the computer of choice of my kids for school. Mainly because it seems to stay clear of viruses found on the internet and ease of use. This is the third one I've purchased.
customer_reviews.author: John J.

product_meta.title: Acer Chromebook 11, Celeron N3060, 11.6" HD, 4GB DDR3L, 16GB Storage, CB3-132-C4VV
product_meta.description: Style:PC onlyAcer Chromebook 11 CB3-132-C4VV comes with these high level specs: Intel Celeron N3060 Dual-Core Processor 1.6GHz with Intel Burst Technology up to 2.48GHz, Google Chrome Operating System, 11.6" HD Widescreen Comfy View LED-backlit IPS Display, Intel HD Graphics, 4GB DDR3L SDRAM Memory, 16GB Internal Storage, 802.11ac Wi-Fi featuring MIMO technology (Dual-Band 2.4GHz and 5GHz), Bluetooth 4.0, HD Webcam (1280 x 720) supporting High Dynamic Range (HDR), 1 - USB 3.0 Port, 1 - USB 2.0 Port, 1 - HDMI Port, 3-Cell Li-Ion Battery (3490 mAh), Up to 10-hours Battery Life, 2.43 lbs. | 1.1 kg (system unit only) (NX.G4XAA.002). Wireless LAN Standard- IEEE 802.11ac. Tamper-proof Keyboard - Recessed keys prevent picky fingers digging up the keyboard
feature_bullets: Chromebook runs on Chrome OS - an operating system by Google that is built for the way we live today. It comes with built-in virus protection, updates automatically*, boots up in seconds and continues to stay fast over time. (*Internet connection is required).
All the Google apps you know and love come standard on every Chromebook, which means you can edit, download, and convert Microsoft Office files in Google Docs, Sheets and Slides.
With the Google Play Store, you can access a rich library of apps, games, music, movies, TV, books, magazines, and more, all from your Chromebook.
Chromebooks come with built-in storage for offline access to your most important files and an additional 100GB of Google Drive space to ensure that all of your files are backed up automatically.
Intel Celeron N3060, 11.6” HD Display, 4GB Memory, 16GB eMMC and Up to 10-hour Battery Life

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars734 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
